name: Bed mobilization frequency
functionStatement: Peak flows reshape channel without chronic instability, redistribute wood and sediment, reset habitats, and supply nutrients to floodplains.
descriptionMarkdown: Bed sediments mobilize near bankfull (~1-2 yr), maintaining a stable but dynamic channel.
howToMeasureMarkdown: Estimate critical discharge from Shields using D50 and compare to flood recurrence estimates. Use qualitative checks where data are limited.

levels.label: Optimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Bed mobilizes at appropriate flows for the channel type, often near bankfull.

levels.label: Suboptimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Slight mismatch. Bed moves below or above expected flows.

levels.label: Marginal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Marked mismatch. Bed is often locked or frequently scoured.

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Extreme mismatch. Bed rarely moves or is reworked by small floods.

references: USGS PeakFQ or flow-frequency statistics (where available)
